item.description:
Objectif Varsovie 1944 (Target Warsaw 1944) covers the second part of the soviet offensive against the Heeresgruppe Mitte. The victorious red army runs towards oriental Prussia and the polish capital city.
It expands the first game, Bagration 1944, which covered the 2 first weeks of battle and the capture of Minsk. The 2 games can either be played separately or linked as a campaign game.

Objectif Varsovie 1944 is a 2-player game, one representing the commander of German forces and the other the commander of Soviet forces. It is played on a map covering the operation theater. It is divided into hexagons representing 20 km. It uses die-cut counters representing military units that participated in this campaign: German divisions and Russian army corps. A full game lasts 15 turns, each representing two days of real time.

Ziplock game with:
- one A2-size map
- 192 die-cut counters
- 16 pages full color rules (both French and English)
- A quick reference aid
- A german display for operation points
- A soviet display for operation points
